word:
MR No. 197 - Additional Statements Regarding Stephen N. Haskell

     The man who is to come to Chicago must not on any account enter into any controversies with any men. . . . He will seek to be original and in doing this will get odd notions, and we want nothing of the kind to come in. Our work must move in a dignified, elevated, ennobling manner.--Letter 96, 1900, p. 5. (To Brother and Sister S. N. Haskell, July 3, 1900.)
